channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: 'What the f**k to do with them?': Russian soldiers hostile to arriving North Korean soldiers, intercepts show
item.description: Russian soldiers are apprehensive about the arrival of North Korean troops, criticizing the command structure and support logistics. Ukraine's Defense Intelligence intercepted communications revealing these concerns. North Korean troops have been spotted in Russia's Kursk region, and Ukrainian President Zelenskyy condemned this escalation, urging international pressure against Moscow and Pyongyang.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Washington Post won't endorse Trump or Harris this election -- first time in 36 years
item.description: ​Earlier it was reported that the paper was dragging its feet on the decision as owner Jeff Bezos is not willing to endorse Kamala Harris alienating Donald Trump. The decision to not endorse anyone confirms the dithering. A New York Post report earlier said that the editorial board of the Washington Post wrote its endorsement of Kamala Harris but received no approval from Bezos or Will Lewis to publish it.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Donald Trump adds golf swing to his iconic dance moves, social media reacts
item.description: Former US President Donald Trump added a golf swing to his signature dance moves at a rally, sparking online reactions. Despite Village People's earlier objections to Trump's usage of their song "YMCA," frontman Victor Willis has decided to permit its use until the 2024 campaign's end.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Vivek Ramaswamy reveals Trump's rare human trait, says 'couldn't be more impressed'
item.description: JD Vance said Donald Trump's energy level is off the charts and it's crazy how little Donald Trump sleeps. "I sleep less than most people. Not saying it's good or bad, just the way I'm constituted. Trump sleeps less than I do, does as many (or more) events, and will still randomly call me to check on my family. It's the craziest thing," Vance said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ukraine's bid to add Russia to FATF's 'black list' fails as India, China reject move
item.description: Ukraine's bid to blacklist Russia over high-risk money laundering was rejected by India, China, Saudi Arabia, and South Africa during the FATF discussions in Paris. Brazil also opposed the proposal, which led to a delay for further evidence gathering. Russia's FATF membership remains suspended.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump's Joe Rogan interview today: Time, past controversies - what we know
item.description: Joe Rogan Podcast: Donald Trump is set to record an interview with Joe Rogan in Austin today though the episode's release date is unknown. Joe Rogan in 2022 called Donald Trump a threat to democracy, endorsed RFK Jr's candidacy for the presidential race over Donald Trump when Kennedy Jr was still an independent candidate, and also praised Kamala Harris' debate performance.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: JD Vance says many of his friends won't vote for him; 'That doesn't...'
item.description: "Whether you vote for me, whether you vote for Donald Trump, whether you vote for Kamala Harris…don't cast aside family members and lifelong friendships. Politics is not worth it. And I think we follow that principle, we will heal the divide in this country," JD Vance said speaking at the News Nation Town Hall.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Sick s**t': Diddy's star-studded parties were ruse to 'freak offs', claims report
item.description: The recent lawsuits against Diddy prove that the Hollywood parties that Diddy used to throw after major events turned into orgies later. One famous Diddy party has been mentioned which was an afterparty from the MTV VMAs in 2005. Eva Longoria, Fergie, Ice-T, Quincy Jones, Paris Hilton were all present at the party but new lawsuits mention the same party where one or several have been raped.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: NYT/Sienna final poll says Kamala Harris, Donald Trump tied at 48 per cent popular vote
item.description: With 10 days left for the 2024 election, a NYT/Sienna College poll reveals a tie between Kamala Harris and Donald Trump at 48% each. Early voting favors Harris significantly, while Trump gains on immigration issues. The poll found that the 9 per cent of Americans who said they already had voted leaned heavily toward Harris -- 59 per cent to 40 per cent. This is a tradition that Democrats generally win in early voting and mail voting.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Japan to resume trial removal of Fukushima nuclear debris: Reports
item.description: The operator of Japan's stricken Fukushima nuclear plant will resume an operation to remove a sample of highly radioactive material next week, reports said Friday, after having suspended the effort over a technical snag. TEPCO on Friday said it would resume the removal on Monday after replacing the cameras with new ones, the Asahi Shimbun daily and other local media reported.

item.title: Why President Biden said that he would apologise to Native Americans
item.description: President Joe Biden will deliver a formal apology for the U.S. government's role in the boarding school system that forced Indigenous children from their families and subjected them to abuse. The apology, to be made during a visit to the Gila River Indian Community in Arizona, addresses the long-lasting scars inflicted on generations.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: From rags to riches: Dean Forbes crowned UK’s most influential Black person
item.description: Dean Forbes, named the UK’s most influential Black individual, leads Forterro, a €2 billion tech firm. From homelessness to CEO, Forbes leverages his platform to advocate for inclusivity and inspire young Black Britons. He also heads a charitable group that raised over £400,000 this year.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Nasa's SpaceX Dragon spacecraft returns to Earth after 236 days in space
item.description: NASA's Crew-8 mission has concluded after 236 days in space, as the team successfully splashed down off Pensacola, Florida, in a SpaceX Dragon spacecraft. The mission covered 100 million miles and involved eight spacecraft arrivals and departures at the ISS, underscoring ongoing space station operations.
item.dc:creator: TOI Science Desk

item.title: Hurricane Kristy strengthens into a Category 5 storm, expected to weaken over open Pacific waters
item.description: Hurricane Kristy has intensified into a Category 5 storm in the Pacific, becoming the first such storm without El Niño since 2010. Currently moving westward, Kristy is expected to weaken over the weekend but will generate hazardous surf conditions along Baja California's west coast.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Kari Lake? Journalist-turned-politician whom Bill Clinton finds ‘physically attractive’
item.description: Kari Lake, Republican US Senate candidate, responded wittily to Bill Clinton's remark calling her 'physically attractive,' referencing his past controversies. Clinton's comment came during a rally in Phoenix supporting Kamala Harris. Lake, a former TV news anchor, previously ran for Arizona governor and is now eyeing the Senate seat against incumbent Kyrsten Sinema and Democrat Ruben Gallego.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: What are the lawsuits against McDonald’s over E. coli outbreak linked to Quarter Pounders?
item.description: McDonald's is facing lawsuits from two individuals who contracted E. coli linked to slivered onions in their Quarter Pounder burgers. The outbreak has affected 49 people across 10 states, resulting in one death. The company has paused onion distribution and initiated a recall.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pakistan terror attack: 10 cops shot dead by Taliban at check post near Afghan border
item.description: Ten police officers were killed and seven injured in a militant attack on a Frontier Constabulary post near Pakistan's Afghan border. The Pakistan Taliban claimed responsibility for the assault in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province. The region has seen increased militancy since the Afghan Taliban's return to power in 2021, with frequent attacks targeting security forces.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Play by the rules': Why Vivek Ramaswamy is pushing for single-day nationwide voting
item.description: At a rally with Donald Trump, Vivek Ramaswamy proposed single-day nationwide voting with paper ballots and government ID. He urged Republicans to participate in early voting to secure a win, comparing the 2024 election to the American Revolution and Trump to George Washington.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Elon Musk fuels Trump campaign with $44 million super PAC donation
item.description: Elon Musk donated $44 million to a pro-Trump super PAC in early October, bringing his total contributions to $75 million. The funds are part of efforts to boost voter turnout in key states for the upcoming election. Concerns arise as Musk's $1 million daily giveaways may violate federal law, sparking Justice Department scrutiny.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'If you wanted to avoid nuclear war then vote ...': How Robert F Kennedy Jr endorsed Trump
item.description: Politician Robert F Kennedy Jr. urges voters to support Donald Trump to avoid nuclear war, claiming Kamala Harris' presidency would lead to conflict. He criticizes Dick Cheney's endorsement of Harris, drawing parallels with past military interventions and highlighting concerns over Harris' foreign policy experience and potential influence by military factions.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
